p: (1) Modification of the Cationic Moiety. The cationic moiety was changed for 2-amino-3-hexadecyloxycarbonylammonium derivatives, namely, comp. 39– 43, and 45. The obtained data demonstrated that N-(2-amino-4-(hexadecyloxy)-4-oxobut-2-en-1-yl)-N,N-dimethylcyclohexanaminium chloride (comp. 39) shows the highest cytotoxicity in all the tested cell lines with a LD 50 value of 97 mg/kg, while alkyl moiety containing compounds—N-(2-amino-4-(hexadecyloxy)-4-oxobut-2-en-1-yl)-N,N-dimethylhexan-1-aminium chloride (comp. 43) and N-(2-amino-4-(hexadecyloxy)-4-oxobut-2-en-1-yl)-N,N-dimethyldodecan-1-aminium chloride (comp. 45)—demonstrated lower cytotoxicity in all the tested cell lines with LD 50 values of 538 and 573 mg/kg, respectively.
